results.headline: Rampant Sociopaths Messing With People’s Heads

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Silver Tongues

results.summary_short: “Silver Tongues,” organized roughly into four vignettes of baffling psychological cruelty, follows a pair of mysterious, middle-aged sociopaths.

results.headline: Amid the Grim Streets, a Pair of Weary Souls

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tyrannosaur

results.summary_short: “Tyrannosaur,” the directing debut of Paddy Considine, puts Peter Mullan in a hard place and then raises the intensity.

results.headline: Edward, You May Now Bite the Bride
results.display_title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part One

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part One

results.summary_short: Robert Pattinson and Kristen Stewart star in Bill Condon’s melodrama — the first of a two-part adaptation of the series’ last book.

results.headline: Supervillains Everywhere and Barely Time to Think

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Heir Apparent: Largo Winch

results.summary_short: “The Heir Apparent: Largo Winch” can be more fun to watch than to hear.

results.headline: The New Bad Boys Decide to Do the Reforming

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of King of Devil's Island

results.summary_short: “King of Devil’s Island” tells the true story of a 1915 rebellion among the inmates at a reformatory for “maladjusted” boys on a bleak Norwegian island.

results.headline: Down the Aisle, Laden With Family Baggage

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Another Happy Day

results.summary_short: A wedding with old regrets, new conflicts, borrowed misery and a lot of blue family members is the subject of “Another Happy Day,” a film by Sam Levinson.

results.headline: The Life Cycles of a Jewish Cemetery
results.display_title: In Heaven Underground: The Weissensee Jewish Cemetery

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of In Heaven Underground: The Weissensee Jewish Cemetery

results.summary_short: “In Heaven, Underground: The Weissensee Jewish Cemetery” is a documentary about this graveyard near Berlin that is one of the oldest active institutions of its kind in Europe.

results.headline: A Search for Self-Discovery, Two Left Feet and All

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Happy Feet Two

results.summary_short: In “Happy Feet Two” the penguin Erik has issues: namely, he can’t dance.

results.headline: Portrait of a World War II Double Agent

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Garbo: The Spy

results.summary_short: “Garbo the Spy” is about the derring-do of the World War II double agent Juan Pujol García and told with the flair of a Hollywood spy movie.

results.headline: At the Altar of Design, When Self-Expression Met Mass Production
results.display_title: Eames the Architect and the Painter

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Eames the Architect and the Painter

results.summary_short: “Eames: The Architect and the Painter” covers the lives of a couple whose approach to product design was in its way as influential as that of Steve Jobs.

results.headline: Revisiting a Brazilian Dance Troupe’s Brush With Fame

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dzi Croquettes

results.summary_short: Tatiana Issa and Raphael Alvarez’s documentary “Dzi Croquettes” recalls the toll that success and other forces took on an all-male Brazilian dance and theater troupe in the 1970s.

results.headline: Recovering Artifacts of Holocaust Victims

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Buried Prayers

results.summary_short: An archaeological team excavates the field of a former death camp in Poland for the personal belongings of Holocaust victims in this documentary directed by Steven Meyer.

results.headline: For One Man, Hawaii Is a Land of Problems

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Descendants

results.summary_short: In “The Descendants,” George Clooney plays the scion of an old Hawaii family with many troubles on his hands.

results.headline: A Summer of Freedoms in Boyhood

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tomboy

results.summary_short: “Tomboy,” an intimately scaled French film, is about a 10-year-old girl who wants to be a boy, or at least enjoy some boyish freedoms.

results.headline: In the Deep Forest, an Unusual Bond and Untamed Beauty

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Letters from the Big Man

results.summary_short: Sasquatch makes a connection with a woman of the woods in Christopher Munch’s lovely, delightfully idiosyncratic “Letters From the Big Man.”

results.headline: Bride’s Mind Is on Another Planet

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Melancholia

results.summary_short: In “Melancholia” the controversial Danish director Lars von Trier offers his own, highly personal version of apocalypse.

results.headline: Exploring Anguish and Absurdity of Killings, Wanton or Sanctioned
results.display_title: Into the Abyss: A Tale of Death, a Tale of Life

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Into the Abyss: A Tale of Death, a Tale of Life

results.summary_short: Werner Herzog’s documentary “Into the Abyss” explores murder and the death penalty, and probes the contradictions of the human heart.

results.headline: Dreamscapes From a Singular Rock Group

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Inni

results.summary_short: The concert film “Inni” showcases the ethereal Icelandic band Sigur Ros.

results.headline: Yearning to Breathe Free on the Web

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Barbershop Punk

results.summary_short: The documentary “Barbershop Punk” follows one man’s battle against Comcast and how it restricts Internet traffic.

results.headline: A Girl and Her Much Nicer Horse

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Greening of Whitney Brown

results.summary_short: In “The Greening of Whitney Brown,” a brat falls on hard times and falls for a horse.
